pullRequest.body:
Add results about operations on the extended real numbers.

- Instances for `EReal`: `CharZero` and `NoZeroDivisors`.
- Results about the coercion to the reals: `toReal_eq_zero_iff`, `toReal_ne_zero_iff`, `toReal_nonneg`, `toReal_nonpos`, `coe_ennreal_toReal`.
- Results about the addition of EReals: `add_ne_bot_iff`, `bot_lt_add_iff`, `add_ne_top` and similar.
- Reorganize and rename the lemmas `le_neg` and similar to make them more consistent, add the missing ones.
- Results about the subtraction of EReals: `top_sub_of_ne_top`, `sub_self`, `sub_self_le_zero`, `sub_nonneg` and similar, `sub_add_cancel` and similar.
- Results about the multiplication of Ereals:  `top_mul_coe_ennreal`, `coe_ennreal_mul_top`, `mul_pos_iff` and similar, `mul_eq_top` and similar, `coe_mul_add_of_nonneg` and other distributivity lemmas, `nsmul_eq_mul`.
- Move and simplify proof of `mul_pos`.
- Clenaup.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [6ec9e50aad](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17087/commits/6ec9e50aad73a308488ff63d748e6a5a3b273ad0)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_ne_bot_iff`
`+ add_ne_top`
`+ add_ne_top_iff_ne_top_left`
`+ add_ne_top_iff_ne_top_right`
`+ add_ne_top_iff_ne_top‚ÇÇ`
`+ add_sub_cancel_left`
`+ coe_ennreal_mul_top`
`+ coe_ennreal_toReal`
`+ instance : CharZero EReal := inferInstanceAs (CharZero (WithBot (WithTop ‚Ñù)))`
`+ instance : NoZeroDivisors EReal`
`+ le_neg`
`+ left_distrib_of_nonneg_of_ne_top`
`+ mul_eq_bot`
`+ mul_eq_top`
`+ mul_ne_bot`
`+ mul_ne_top`
`+ mul_neg_iff`
`+ mul_nonneg_iff`
`+ mul_nonpos_iff`
`+ mul_pos_iff`
`+ nsmul_eq_mul`
`+ right_distrib_of_nonneg_of_ne_top`
`+ sub_add_cancel`
`+ sub_add_cancel_right`
`+ sub_neg`
`+ sub_nonneg`
`+ sub_nonpos`
`+ sub_pos`
`+ sub_self`
`+ sub_self_le_zero`
`+ toReal_eq_toReal`
`+ toReal_eq_zero_iff`
`+ toReal_ne_zero_iff`
`+ toReal_nonneg`
`+ toReal_nonpos`
`+ top_mul_coe_ennreal`
`+ top_sub`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This is quite a big PR, and contains a lot of changes to reformat existing code in a way that is not backed by a consensus that I'm aware of. I would suggest you start by reverting the formatting changes, and hopefully the rest of the PR will look more approachable.
Thank you @Ruben-VandeVelde, I removed all the formatting changes to existing code, now the PR should look less scary.
Thanks!
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by faenuccio.

bors r+
Thanks!

For the time being I have just checked `Mathlib\Data\Real\EReal.lean`, and it is very good. Besides addressing my comments, can you also add some `doc` at the top of that file documenting your additions?

```suggestion
  simp only [ne_eq, toReal_eq_zero_iff, not_or]
```

```suggestion
  cases x <;> norm_num
```
Not really because `cases` is shorter, but because it is in some sense a more fundamental tactic wrt inductive types. If you have strong arguments for `induction` I am eager to read (but my comments applies to several of your proofs below).
Why are you removing this `simp` attributes?

Because `simp` alone can already prove these lemmas.
In this case it is ok to remove the `@[simp]`, right?
Sure, my bad! Thanks.

```suggestion
  simpa only [lt_top_iff_ne_top] using add_lt_top hx hy
```
I don't really understand the name of this lemma

I'm not sure how else we could call it, this is basically the description of the statement: if the elements are not bot (`of_ne_bot`), then the sum is not top (`add_ne_top`) if and only if (`iff`) something...
The only other name that comes to mind is `add_ne_top_iff_ne_top_of_ne_bot`, which is even longer.
Well, but the `of_` part refers to the assumptions `hx` and `hy`. I would go for `add_ne_top_iff_ne_top2` (with the `2` as a subscript, but cannot do this in this github comment...)
I don't really understand the name of this lemma

Same as above. 
Here maybe we could name it something like `add_ne_top_iff_of_finite` or `add_finite_ne_top_iff_ne_top`, since we are basically asking for `y` to be finite, but I'm not sure these names are actually acceptable, because nothing named `finite` actually appears in the statement...
I agree that `finite` is not an option, but perhaps my suggestion above helps?

Thank you for the suggestion!
I'm not sure how you intend it to be extended to this lemma, is it one of the following?

1. `add_ne_top_iff_ne_top`
2. `add_ne_top_iff_ne_top_left` (then maybe add the `_right` version)
3. `add_ne_top_iff_ne_top‚ÇÅ` (I don't think this is what you meant, but I'm adding it just in case)
Option 2. (with the addition) is certainly the best!
I must say that I prefer the previous version with "if..."

I don't have a strong opinion about this, I mainly changed it for consistency, since `neg_le` already had the comment:
```
/-- `-a ‚â§ b ‚Üî -b ‚â§ a` on `EReal`. -/
```
Do you think I should also change the `‚Üî` to `iff` there?
Yes, personally I find it nicer that we use plain normal English in comments everywehere.
why the `_comm`?

I originally renamed the theorem to `neg_lt` in this PR to be consistent with `neg_le` and the same lemmas for additive groups, but a few days ago the new name `neg_lt_comm` was approved (#18879) and I did not want to revert the decision.
However `neg_lt` and `lt_neg` look like most natural names for these results, so maybe we should just change them.
What do you think? 
And if we change them, how should we handle the double deprecation on the first one?
Why not marking `sub_bot` and `_top` as `simp`?

```suggestion
  cases x <;> cases y <;> simp_all [‚Üê EReal.coe_sub]
```
Just to remind you that well above I suggested this change...
Although I appreciate the synthesis, I think that expanding this proof a bit might help. In particular, constructing the huge function term in the `exact` is a bit cheating, no?

```suggestion
    refine ‚ü®fun H ‚Ü¶ ?_, fun H ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü© <;>
    cases H with
```

```suggestion
    simpa only [EReal.coe_ne_bot, EReal.coe_neg', false_and, and_false, EReal.coe_ne_top,
      EReal.coe_pos, or_self, iff_false, EReal.coe_mul] using EReal.coe_ne_top _
```
Since setting options while using tactics is poorly documented, can you add a line explaining what you're doing here?

```suggestion
    rw_mod_cast [mul_add]
```

```suggestion
  simpa only [EReal.mul_comm] using left_distrib_of_nonneg_of_ne_top hx_nonneg hx_ne_top y z
```

```suggestion
see `Ereal.left_distrib_of_nonneg_of_ne_top`, or `0 ‚â§ y, z`, see
`Ereal.left_distrib_of_nonneg` (similarily
```
can you check more generally that in the doc all declarations are called with their full name (including the namespace)? This makes the website links work.

```suggestion
  cases x <;> simp_all only [ne_eq, not_true_eq_false]
  cases y <;> simp_all only [coe_ne_bot, not_false_eq_true, not_true_eq_false]
```
When `simp` calls are not terminating, it is better to reduce them to `simp only` calls.

```suggestion
/-- `-a ‚â§ b` if and only if `-b ‚â§ a` on `EReal`. -/
```
Let's respect English language a bit :smile:

```suggestion
/-- `a ‚â§ -b` if and only if `b ‚â§ -a` on `EReal`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- `-a < b` if and only if `-b < a` on `EReal`. -/
```
Please take care of all the other `iff`...
Since you won't need `hx0` any more, you could also do `replace hx0 : 0 < x`... to have one hypothesis less in the context.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/EReal): Add results about `EReal`
